class raytrace.BuieDistribution(CircumSolarRatio)[source]¶

A distribution for the direct light from the sun according to the Buie model: Buie, D., 2005. Corrigendum to “The effective size of the solar cone for solar concentrating systems” [Solar Energy 74 (2003) 417-427]. Solar Energy 79, 568-570. 5.2

static th_solar_disk_region(u, a1, SD)[source]¶

class raytrace.Experiment(scene, light_source, number_of_rays, show_in_doc=None)[source]¶

Sets up and runs and experiment in a given scene with a given light source. If show_in_doc is given, the emitting region is drawn in the FreeCAD active document. If show_in_doc is given, the rays could be drawn in the FreeCAD active document (using the run function).

class raytrace.LightSource(scene, emitting_region, light_spectrum, initial_energy, direction_distribution=None, polarization_vector=None)[source]¶

Sets up a light source with a given scene, a given emitting region and a given light spectrum. The emitting region must provide the main direction. Light spectrum could be: a constant value (for a single wavelength in nanometers), or a spectrum distribution. The distribution (dispersion) for the main direction is provided in “direction_distribution”. The polarization_vector is a Base.Vector for polarized light. If is not given unpolarized light is generated.

class raytrace.Material(name, properties)[source]¶

Class used to represent materials and their physical properties

class raytrace.Ray(scene, origin, direction, properties)[source]¶

Class used to model a sun ray and its polarization vector. It keeps information of the path it describes as it interacts with the scene and its energy.

next_direction(face)[source]¶

Computes the next direction of the ray as it interacts with the scene, the material where the ray will be travelling next and a string representing the physical phenomenon that took place

next_intersection()[source]¶

Computes the next intersection of the ray with the scene. Returns a pair (point,face), where point is the point of intersection and face is the face that intersects. If no intersection is found, it returns a “point at infinity” and None.

run(max_hops=20)[source]¶

Makes a sun ray propagate until it gets absorbed, it exits the scene, or gets caught in multiple (> max_hops) reflections.

class raytrace.Scene(objects)[source]¶

Class used to define the Scene. It encodes all the objects that interfere with light rays.

face_at_point(point)[source]¶

Returns the face that a point is inside.

solid_at_point(point)[source]¶

Returns the solid that a point is inside.

class raytrace.SunWindow(scene, direction)[source]¶

Class used to define a sun window, defined as a rectangle in space such that the projection of the scene on the plane is enclosed in the rectangle, the rectangle has an increase of 10% in each length

raytrace.TW_absorptance_ratio(normal, b_constant, c_constant, incident)[source]¶

Implementation of the angular Solar Absorptance model for selective absorber material. 1 - b * (1/cos - 1) ** c Model based on the study: Tesfamichael, T., and Wäckelgard, E., 2000, “Angular Solar Absorptance and Incident Angle Modifier of Selective Absorbers for Solar Thermal Collectors,” Sol. Energy, 68, pp. 335–341.

raytrace.calculate_reflectance(matrix_reflectance, angle, wavelength)[source]¶
data_array: values needed for the interpolation
We generate an interpolation to find the perpendicular and parallel reflectance depending on the angle and wavelength

raytrace.matrix_reflectance(data_material)[source]¶
